Frequently Asked Questions Hormone-balancing supplements can work differently for different people. For example, diindolylmethane (DIM) supplement may help with estrogen dominance in men and women and restores healthy hormonal balance. However, It is best to talk to your healthcare provider about which supplements may be best suited for your specific needs. Some signs of hormonal imbalance can include fatigue and difficulty sleeping, sudden changes in mood, weight gain or loss, irregular menstrual cycles, impotence or infertility in men, and hair loss. If you experience any of these symptoms, it is important to speak to your healthcare provider for an accurate diagnosis. Your doctor may order blood tests to assess your hormone levels and discuss potential lifestyle changes and treatments that could help with balance. How quickly hormones can be restored to balance depends on each individual's situation. For example, lifestyle changes such as getting enough sleep and exercise, reducing stress, and eating a nutrient-rich diet may help restore hormone balance relatively quickly. Additionally, certain medications and supplements can also help with the process. The amount of time it takes to see results from these interventions will vary from person to person.
